verses.verse: Comfort<WH5162> ye, comfort<WH5162> ye my people<WH5971>, saith<WH559> your God<WH430>.

Speak<WH1696> ye comfortably<WH3820> to Jerusalem<WH3389>, and cry<WH7121> unto her, that her warfare<WH6635> is accomplished<WH4390>, that her iniquity<WH5771> is pardoned<WH7521>: for she hath received<WH3947> of the LORD's<WH3068> hand<WH3027> double<WH3718> for all her sins<WH2403>.

¶ The voice<WH6963> of him that crieth<WH7121> in the wilderness<WH4057>, Prepare<WH6437> ye the way<WH1870> of the LORD<WH3068>, make straight<WH3474> in the desert<WH6160> a highway<WH4546> for our God<WH430>.

Every valley<WH1516> shall be exalted<WH5375>, and every mountain<WH2022> and hill<WH1389> shall be made low<WH8213>: and the crooked<WH6121> shall be made straight<WH4334>, and the rough places<WH7406> plain<WH1237>:
And the glory<WH3519> of the LORD<WH3068> shall be revealed<WH1540>, and all flesh<WH1320> shall see<WH7200> it together<WH3162>: for the mouth<WH6310> of the LORD<WH3068> hath spoken<WH1696> it.

The voice<WH6963> said<WH559>, Cry<WH7121>. And he said<WH559>, What shall I cry<WH7121>? All flesh<WH1320> is grass<WH2682>, and all the goodliness<WH2617> thereof is as the flower<WH6731> of the field<WH7704>:
The grass<WH2682> withereth<WH3001>, the flower<WH6731> fadeth<WH5034>: because the spirit<WH7307> of the LORD<WH3068> bloweth<WH5380> upon it: surely<WH403> the people<WH5971> is grass<WH2682>.
The grass<WH2682> withereth<WH3001>, the flower<WH6731> fadeth<WH5034>: but the word<WH1697> of our God<WH430> shall stand<WH6965> for ever<WH5769>.

¶ O Zion<WH6726>, that bringest good tidings<WH1319>, get thee up<WH5927> into the high<WH1364> mountain<WH2022>; O Jerusalem<WH3389>, that bringest good tidings<WH1319>, lift up<WH7311> thy voice<WH6963> with strength<WH3581>; lift it up<WH7311>, be not afraid<WH3372>; say<WH559> unto the cities<WH5892> of Judah<WH3063>, Behold your God<WH430>!

Behold, the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069> will come<WH935> with strong<WH2389> hand, and his arm<WH2220> shall rule<WH4910> for him: behold, his reward<WH7939> is with him, and his work<WH6468> before<WH6440> him.

He shall feed<WH7462> his flock<WH5739> like a shepherd<WH7462>: he shall gather<WH6908> the lambs<WH2922> with his arm<WH2220>, and carry<WH5375> them in his bosom<WH2436>, and shall gently lead<WH5095> those that are with young<WH5763>.

¶ Who hath measured<WH4058> the waters<WH4325> in the hollow of his hand<WH8168>, and meted out<WH8505> heaven<WH8064> with the span<WH2239>, and comprehended<WH3557> the dust<WH6083> of the earth<WH776> in a measure<WH7991>, and weighed<WH8254> the mountains<WH2022> in scales<WH6425>, and the hills<WH1389> in a balance<WH3976>?
Who hath directed<WH8505> the Spirit<WH7307> of the LORD<WH3068>, or being his counseller<WH376><WH6098> hath taught<WH3045> him?

With whom took he counsel<WH3289>, and who instructed<WH995> him, and taught<WH3925> him in the path<WH734> of judgment<WH4941>, and taught<WH3925> him knowledge<WH1847>, and shewed<WH3045> to him the way<WH1870> of understanding<WH8394>?

Behold, the nations<WH1471> are as a drop<WH4752> of a bucket<WH1805>, and are counted<WH2803> as the small dust<WH7834> of the balance<WH3976>: behold, he taketh up<WH5190> the isles<WH339> as a very little thing<WH1851>.
And Lebanon<WH3844> is not<WH369> sufficient<WH1767> to burn<WH1197>, nor the beasts<WH2416> thereof sufficient<WH1767> for a burnt offering<WH5930>.
All nations<WH1471> before him are as nothing; and they are counted<WH2803> to him less than nothing<WH657>, and vanity<WH8414>.
¶ To whom then will ye liken<WH1819> God<WH410>? or what likeness<WH1823> will ye compare<WH6186> unto him?
The workman<WH2796> melteth<WH5258> a graven image<WH6459>, and the goldsmith<WH6884> spreadeth<WH7554> it over with gold<WH2091>, and casteth<WH6884> silver<WH3701> chains<WH7577>.

He that is so impoverished<WH5533><WH5534> that he hath no oblation<WH8641> chooseth<WH977> a tree<WH6086> that will not rot<WH7537>; he seeketh<WH1245> unto him a cunning<WH2450> workman<WH2796> to prepare<WH3559> a graven image<WH6459>, that shall not be moved<WH4131>.
Have ye not known<WH3045>? have ye not heard<WH8085>? hath it not been told<WH5046> you from the beginning<WH7218>? have ye not understood<WH995> from the foundations<WH4146> of the earth<WH776>?

It is he that sitteth<WH3427> upon the circle<WH2329> of the earth<WH776>, and the inhabitants<WH3427> thereof are as grasshoppers<WH2284>; that stretcheth out<WH5186> the heavens<WH8064> as a curtain<WH1852>, and spreadeth them out<WH4969> as a tent<WH168> to dwell in<WH3427>:
That bringeth<WH5414> the princes<WH7336> to nothing; he maketh<WH6213> the judges<WH8199> of the earth<WH776> as vanity<WH8414>.

Yea, they shall not be planted<WH5193>; yea, they shall not be sown<WH2232>: yea, their stock<WH1503> shall not take root<WH8327> in the earth<WH776>: and he shall also blow<WH5398> upon them, and they shall wither<WH3001>, and the whirlwind<WH5591> shall take<WH5375> them away as stubble<WH7179>.
To whom then will ye liken<WH1819> me, or shall I be equal<WH7737>? saith<WH559> the Holy One<WH6918>.

Lift up<WH5375> your eyes<WH5869> on high<WH4791>, and behold<WH7200> who hath created<WH1254> these things, that bringeth out<WH3318> their host<WH6635> by number<WH4557>: he calleth<WH7121> them all by names<WH8034> by the greatness<WH7230> of his might<WH202>, for that he is strong<WH533> in power<WH3581>; not one<WH376> faileth<WH5737>.

Why sayest<WH559> thou, O Jacob<WH3290>, and speakest<WH1696>, O Israel<WH3478>, My way<WH1870> is hid<WH5641> from the LORD<WH3068>, and my judgment<WH4941> is passed over<WH5674> from my God<WH430>?

¶ Hast thou not known<WH3045>? hast thou not heard<WH8085>, that the everlasting<WH5769> God<WH430>, the LORD<WH3068>, the Creator<WH1254> of the ends<WH7098> of the earth<WH776>, fainteth<WH3286> not, neither is weary<WH3021>? there is no searching<WH2714> of his understanding<WH8394>.
He giveth<WH5414> power<WH3581> to the faint<WH3287>; and to them that have no might<WH202> he increaseth<WH7235> strength<WH6109>.
Even the youths<WH5288> shall faint<WH3286> and be weary<WH3021>, and the young men<WH970> shall utterly<WH3782> fall<WH3782>:

But they that wait<WH6960> upon the LORD<WH3068> shall renew<WH2498> their strength<WH3581>; they shall mount up<WH5927> with wings<WH83> as eagles<WH5404>; they shall run<WH7323>, and not be weary<WH3021>; and they shall walk<WH3212>, and not faint<WH3286>.
